# Week 04 Misc Newsletter Analysis (January 19-25, 2026)

## Overview

Week 04 brought a diverse mix of geopolitical tensions, automotive innovation, and daily curated content. [The Free Press](https://substack.com/redirect/7b7966b5-418b-4de3-b3a7-997cde5f3724?j=eyJ1IjoiMWllZnkifQ.sG3OqnkHDNZpplC0eLA9u0NYhAE4J8yHwSPDyeVA8k8) led with Trump's escalating demands over Greenland and the resulting European tensions, while [Core Memory](https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY29yZW1lbW9yeS5jb20vcC93ZS13ZW50LXRvLWRldHJvaXQtdG8tc2VlLWdtcy1lbGVjdHJpYy12ZWhpY2xlLXdvbmRlcmxhbmQ_.YKnY2GQ6CeVYVy86RXRnpLdtWoShvIPvuAu7veZGvQo?) provided an in-depth look at GM's electric vehicle efforts and the lingering political fallout from Biden's 2021 EV summit snub. [News Minimalist](https://newsletter.newsminimalist.com/p/eu-and-mercosur-sign-trade-deal-after-25-years-of-negotiations) delivered AI-curated global news highlights including a landmark EU-Mercosur trade deal, while Blocked and Reported and Mailbrew rounded out the week with podcast content and tech aggregation.

---

## Major Topics and Stories

### 1. Trump's Greenland Escalation and European Response

**Coverage:** [The Free Press](https://substack.com/redirect/7b7966b5-418b-4de3-b3a7-997cde5f3724?j=eyJ1IjoiMWllZnkifQ.sG3OqnkHDNZpplC0eLA9u0NYhAE4J8yHwSPDyeVA8k8)

President Trump dramatically escalated his push to acquire Greenland, threatening 10 percent tariffs on imports from Denmark and six other European nations starting February 1, with increases to 25 percent by June 1 unless Denmark agrees to a "complete and total purchase" of Greenland. The move represents a significant shift from typical Trump rhetoric into concrete economic threats.

> "It is time for Denmark to give back—World peace is at stake!" — [The Free Press](https://substack.com/redirect/7b7966b5-418b-4de3-b3a7-997cde5f3724?j=eyJ1IjoiMWllZnkifQ.sG3OqnkHDNZpplC0eLA9u0NYhAE4J8yHwSPDyeVA8k8)

European leaders responded by considering retaliatory tariffs worth $93 billion. The Free Press editorial characterized this as "geopolitical petulance" that risks undermining Trump's foreign policy achievements. The story also highlighted growing tensions with other developments: the Pentagon preparing 1,500 soldiers for possible deployment in Minnesota, and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey declaring he "never thought in a million years that we would be invaded by our own federal government."

### 2. GM's Electric Vehicle Push and the Biden Snub Legacy

**Coverage:** [Core Memory](https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY29yZW1lbW9yeS5jb20vcC93ZS13ZW50LXRvLWRldHJvaXQtdG8tc2VlLWdtcy1lbGVjdHJpYy12ZWhpY2xlLXdvbmRlcmxhbmQ_.YKnY2GQ6CeVYVy86RXRnpLdtWoShvIPvuAu7veZGvQo?)

Ashlee Vance provided a comprehensive on-the-ground report from Detroit examining GM's electric vehicle ambitions, framed through the lens of Biden's controversial 2021 EV summit that excluded Tesla and Elon Musk. The article chronicles how Biden's decision to praise GM for "electrifying the entire automotive industry" created a political rift that continues to reverberate.

GM now holds 14 percent of the US electric vehicle market share, second to Tesla's 43 percent. The company has invested billions in battery research, particularly in Lithium Manganese-Rich (LMR) batteries that trade some energy density for lower costs. Vance notes GM is attempting to bring "every part of EV manufacturing from the mines to the assembly lines to the US," though he remains "skeptical on the execution."

> "Musk had every right to be pissed. Tesla had created the electric vehicle industry more or less out of nothing and established the US as the leader in the field." — [Core Memory](https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY29yZW1lbW9yeS5jb20vcC93ZS13ZW50LXRvLWRldHJvaXQtdG8tc2VlLWdtcy1lbGVjdHJpYy12ZWhpY2xlLXdvbmRlcmxhbmQ_.YKnY2GQ6CeVYVy86RXRnpLdtWoShvIPvuAu7veZGvQo?)

The timing is particularly challenging for GM: Trump just yanked EV rebates and loosened environmental restrictions, and GM recorded a $7.1 billion loss partly due to write-downs of EV assembly lines and battery factories.

### 3. Global Trade and Geopolitical Shifts

**Coverage:** [News Minimalist](https://newsletter.newsminimalist.com/p/eu-and-mercosur-sign-trade-deal-after-25-years-of-negotiations)

The AI-curated news digest highlighted several significant international developments, most notably the European Union and Mercosur signing a landmark free trade agreement after 25 years of negotiations. The deal establishes one of the world's largest trade zones covering 700 million consumers, eliminating over 90 percent of tariffs.

Other notable stories included:
- China's population declining for the fourth consecutive year with a record-low birth rate of 5.63 per 1,000 people
- The world's first legally binding High Seas Treaty taking effect to protect marine life across two-thirds of the planet's oceans
- Taiwan investing $250 billion in US semiconductor manufacturing
- Canada and China forging new trade ties as relations thaw

### 4. Domestic Political Controversies

**Coverage:** [The Free Press](https://substack.com/redirect/7b7966b5-418b-4de3-b3a7-997cde5f3724?j=eyJ1IjoiMWllZnkifQ.sG3OqnkHDNZpplC0eLA9u0NYhAE4J8yHwSPDyeVA8k8)

The Free Press covered several contentious domestic stories beyond the Greenland issue. Josh Shapiro revealed in his new memoir that during Kamala Harris's vice presidential search, he was asked by her team whether he was an Israeli agent, a question he found "offensive."

Public opinion on ICE operations shows complexity: a CBS News poll found that a majority of Americans say ICE is making communities where it operates less safe, with 61 percent saying ICE is being too tough when stopping and detaining people.

### 5. Canadian Political Culture

**Coverage:** Blocked and Reported

Katie Herzog spoke with Quillette's Jonathan Kay for an extended conversation about Canadian politics, covering conspiracy theories, the "illiberal right vs. the illiberal left," and distinctly Canadian policy controversies. The premium subscriber content included discussions of residential schools grave scandals, Canada's euthanasia program (MAID), and pronoun policies—topics that highlight Canada's unique position in Western political debates.

### 6. Tech and Product Aggregation

**Coverage:** Mailbrew

The daily digest aggregated trending items from Hacker News and Product Hunt, including discussions on Gaussian Splatting in A$AP Rocky's music video, predictions about OpenAI's ad strategy, the "Dead Internet Theory," and Flux 2 Klein pure C inference. Product Hunt highlights included Noodle Seed (connecting businesses to AI conversations), OS Ninja (exploring open source with AI), and FlowGenie (form building and workflow automation).

---

## Cross-Newsletter Patterns

**Political Decisions Creating Long-Term Consequences**: Both [The Free Press](https://substack.com/redirect/7b7966b5-418b-4de3-b3a7-997cde5f3724?j=eyJ1IjoiMWllZnkifQ.sG3OqnkHDNZpplC0eLA9u0NYhAE4J8yHwSPDyeVA8k8) and [Core Memory](https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY29yZW1lbW9yeS5jb20vcC93ZS13ZW50LXRvLWRldHJvaXQtdG8tc2VlLWdtcy1lbGVjdHJpYy12ZWhpY2xlLXdvbmRlcmxhbmQ_.YKnY2GQ6CeVYVy86RXRnpLdtWoShvIPvuAu7veZGvQo?) emphasized how single political decisions—Trump's Greenland tariff threats and Biden's Tesla snub—create cascading effects that reshape industries and geopolitics. The Biden-Musk rift is portrayed as having directly contributed to the current political realignment.

**US-Europe Tensions**: The Greenland crisis covered by [The Free Press](https://substack.com/redirect/7b7966b5-418b-4de3-b3a7-997cde5f3724?j=eyJ1IjoiMWllZnkifQ.sG3OqnkHDNZpplC0eLA9u0NYhAE4J8yHwSPDyeVA8k8) contrasts with the global trade cooperation highlighted by [News Minimalist](https://newsletter.newsminimalist.com/p/eu-and-mercosur-sign-trade-deal-after-25-years-of-negotiations), suggesting divergent trends in international relations—Atlantic alliance strain alongside emerging South-South cooperation.

**Electric Vehicle Industry Headwinds**: [Core Memory](https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY29yZW1lbW9yeS5jb20vcC93ZS13ZW50LXRvLWRldHJvaXQtdG8tc2VlLWdtcy1lbGVjdHJpYy12ZWhpY2xlLXdvbmRlcmxhbmQ_.YKnY2GQ6CeVYVy86RXRnpLdtWoShvIPvuAu7veZGvQo?)'s coverage of GM's $7.1 billion loss and Trump eliminating EV rebates paints a picture of an industry facing policy whiplash just as major investments come due.

**Federal vs. Local Power**: [The Free Press](https://substack.com/redirect/7b7966b5-418b-4de3-b3a7-997cde5f3724?j=eyJ1IjoiMWllZnkifQ.sG3OqnkHDNZpplC0eLA9u0NYhAE4J8yHwSPDyeVA8k8) documented mounting tensions between federal immigration enforcement and local resistance, framing it in almost militaristic terms with Pentagon deployments and mayoral defiance.
